criterion: Provides a routine that includes exercises that are contraindicated for postpartum women.
Does not advise seeking medical clearance before starting advanced Kegel exercises.
Uses technical medical jargon that is difficult for a non-medical professional to understand.
Asks the user to clarify any questions or concerns they may have about the advanced Kegel routine.
Provides a routine that is tailored to the user's specific needs and goals.
Includes a warning about the importance of proper breathing and relaxation during Kegel exercises.
Provides a routine that is safe and effective for postpartum women.
Does not recommend using any equipment or devices that are not necessary for the advanced Kegel routine.
Includes a reminder to consult with a healthcare provider if any discomfort or pain occurs during the exercises.
Provides a routine that is easy to follow and understand.
Does not suggest that the advanced Kegel routine can cure or prevent any underlying medical conditions.
Asks the user to report any changes in their symptoms or concerns after starting the advanced Kegel routine.
Provides a routine that is consistent with the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) guidelines.
Includes a reminder to start with gentle exercises and gradually increase the intensity and duration.
Does not recommend any exercises that may exacerbate any underlying medical conditions.
Provides a routine that is tailored to the user's specific goals and needs.
Includes a reminder to consult with a healthcare provider if any questions or concerns arise during the exercises.
